Can we add a CLI parameter to let user decide if they would like enable parallelize or not?
Or maybe only enable this feature for topo having large number of neighbors?

> enable this feature for topo having large number of neighb

For the first question, this PR does not introduce a new parallel mechanism. Some tasks were already running in parallel before. What this PR does is extend parallel execution to more time-consuming tasks that were previously executed in serial.

And for the second one, this change improves the overall efficiency of topology deployment. It benefits not only large topologies but also small ones, since reducing serial bottlenecks shortens the total deployment time in all cases.

To further clarify for future reference, the difference here between:

```
400000_5m.
pkts_num_trig_ingr_drp: 136239

400000_40m.
pkts_num_trig_ingr_drp: 136446
```

Is simply due to the difference in headroom for these two cable lengths, but in terms of 254 byte cells. See pg_profile_lookup.ini for this SKU:

```
# speed cable size xon xoff threshold xon_offset
400000 5m 18796 0 393192 0 3556
400000 40m 18796 0 445770 0 3556
```

`((445770 - 393192) / 254) == (136446 - 136239)`

It also suffices to have both sets of static parameters in the params file, but generating these at run time is something I'd like to get to soon.

@rbpittman can I understand the voq watchdog will impact the watermark counter function? if that is the case, how we can get pass in test_qos_sai?

No it doesn't impact watermark function. 
test_qos_sai already disables voq_watchdog, hence this is adding the same disable to the tunnel tests. 
The voq watchdog activates when queues are blocked for a long time, thus it needs to be disabled in long-running TX_DISABLE tests. In this case, the PG watermark would stop going up due to the VOQ watchdog flushing queues.
